paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for KCNH2, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: SCD commonly occurs in SQTS patients between the ages of 20 and 40.
The disease manifestation can vary greatly among patients with different pathogenic gene variants.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No symptoms but carries the variant.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The prevalence of LQTS is approximately 1 in 2000 with a higher occurrence in females.

functional_data.summary: The KCNH2-N588K variant impairs the inactivation of the hERG channel, making it insensitive to blockers.
assays: In vitro studies on drug effects

variants.additional_notes: KCNH2-N588K is one of the most common variants associated with SQTS.
key_quotes: The KCNH2 gene was classified as definitive.
The N588K variant has been shown to render the hERG channel resistant to some drugs.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The clinical symptoms of SQTS include palpitations, syncope, dizziness, and even SCD.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No symptoms but carries the variant.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The disease manifestation can vary greatly among patients with different pathogenic gene variants.

functional_data.summary: The T618I variant is associated with gain-of-function effects on the hERG channel.
assays: In vitro studies on drug effects

variants.additional_notes: KCNH2-T618I is one of the most common variants associated with SQTS.
key_quotes: The KCNH2 gene was classified as definitive.
The T618I variant has been shown to enhance the outward current.

tables_processed.table_caption: Genotype and phenotypes of short-QT syndrome (SQTS) and long-QT syndrome (LQTS).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for KCNH2 variants were extracted successfully.
